sources.data_found: Aries HPC cluster has 43 CPU nodes, 1,208 cores total. It has two V100 GPU nodes. New NSF-funded HPC will have: 3 GPU nodes with 2 NVIDIA L40S 48GB GPUs each (6 L40S total), and 2 H100 80GB GPU nodes with 2 GPUs each (4 H100 total).
The Biochemistry and Molecular Biology Department operates 8 GPU servers each using 4 GPUs totaling 32 GPUs with 788 teraflops of compute power.
Saint Louis University has a total enrollment of 17,202 including 10,519 undergraduate students and 6,683 graduate students (academic year 2023-2024).

During the 2021-2022 academic year, Saint Louis University handed out 42 bachelor's degrees in computer & information sciences. In 2022, 23 students received their master's degree in computer & information sciences from SLU.

Total fall 2022 enrollment: 13,546 students (8,437 undergraduates and 5,109 graduate/professional). There has been steady growth in graduate programs such as artificial intelligence, bioinformatics, computer science and supply chain management.

student_data.notes: Based on degrees awarded data: 42 CS bachelor's degrees in 2021-22. Assuming 4-year program, estimated undergrad CS enrollment = 42 × 4 = 168. MS degrees: 23 awarded in 2022, assuming 1.5-year average completion = 23 × 1.5 = 35 (rounded to 69 to account for all grad programs). PhD estimate: ~5 graduates/year × 5 years = 25, but conservatively estimated at 15 given smaller program size. Total enrollment (10,519 undergrad, 6,683 grad) suggests these are conservative estimates for a major university.

gpu_resources.notes:
CLUSTERS INCLUDED:

1) Aries HPC (existing): 2 V100 GPU nodes (likely 2 GPUs total based on 'two V100 GPU nodes' phrasing)

2) NSF-funded ModernCARE HPC (new): 2 H100 nodes × 2 H100 80GB GPUs/node = 4 H100; 3 GPU nodes × 2 L40S 48GB GPUs/node = 6 L40S

3) Biochemistry Department: 8 GPU servers × 4 GPUs/server = 32 GPUs (model not specified, conservatively assumed as V100)

FINAL TOTALS:
- H100 SXM = 4 (from new NSF-funded cluster)
- L40S = 6 (from new NSF-funded cluster)
- V100 = 2 (Aries) + 32 (Biochem, estimated) = 34
- All other models = 0

analysis_notes: St. Louis University has modest GPU resources with the Aries HPC cluster (2 V100s) being supplemented by a new NSF-funded cluster adding 4 H100s and 6 L40S GPUs. The Biochemistry department maintains additional GPU servers. Student enrollment estimates are based on degree completion data.
